{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328210,"name":"Scott Pantall","username":"scottpantall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/scottpantall/{size}/208084_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T22:56:00.235Z","cooked":"

I’ve found plenty of examples of how to simulate with SparkMax motor controllers by not using REVPhysicsSim or avoiding the problem with interfaces but I haven’t found any examples of anyone successfully using the class provided by Rev Robotics.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T22:56:00.235Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":185.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457960,"topic_slug":"has-anyone-used-revphysicssim-successfully-to-simulate-with-cansparkmax","display_username":"Scott Pantall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62356,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor"},"post_url":"/t/has-anyone-used-revphysicssim-successfully-to-simulate-with-cansparkmax/457960/1","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3328379,"name":"Andrew Schreiber","username":"Andrew_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T04:45:32.463Z","cooked":"

I’ve also not found any examples of it working nor was I able to make it work when I tried. I worked on refactoring our code base to let us wrap the rev stuff in an interface to simulate but it’s ugly and involved. I’ve personally just concluded simulation support is not a priority for Rev. Which is unfortunate for those of us who are in their ecosystem and is making me strongly consider that choice moving forward.

(Edit to remove reference to deleted post)

Yeah so it depends on what you want to do but their simulation support is very very limited if you use the physics sim. With a bit of hacking around and using the Simdevice api from wpilib you can get simulation working with the WPI physics simulation objects. (Not using the Rev physics sim at all) (Slight gotcha if you set a voltage control mode Rev for some reason overwrites the sim value for the velocity to zero).

There are also Rev sim wrapper libraries floating around on Github although I do not know if any of these continued to get maintained past when the flex came out. Over all ive been actively frustrated with how rev has handled Simulation it seems like in many situations they made thing especially hard for no reason.

Edit: Sorry replied to wrong post
